gameOver

void gameOver(boolean sleep)
Terminates game. Also sends out a "GAME OVER" message to the other player and a "gameStop" command to the SNAP servers, if the game hasn't already been terminated.

Parameters:
sleep -

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying()

gameDataReceived

public void gameDataReceived(java.lang.String from,
                             byte[] data)
Handle received game data. Data will be either game setup and synchronization commands, or in-game updates such as current player position and/or heartbeats if the player hasn't moved in a while.

Setup/synchronization updates will result in the game changing setup state & issuing further setup commands. Player position updates will result in the game GUI being updated.

Parameters:
from - The sender of this data.
data - The game data.

getLevel

public char[] getLevel()

pause

public void pause()
Called when the app is put into a paused state, such as during an incoming phone call.

resume

public void resume()
Called when app is woken up from a paused state, e.g. after an incoming call. If the app has been asleep too long, the game will exit.

stop

public void stop()
Terminate the thread driving this instance.

run

public void run()
Main game loop. Executed each time a new game is played. Sends out position updates and/or heartbeats in case the player hasn't moved within the heartbeat interval. Also sends out notification when the user reaches the end of the maze.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
